comment: "This piece was for the lead print piece for the science and technology section of The Economist. The editor is a pain in the backside to be honest -- completely re-writes pieces and doesn't make it clear he expects. The Economist pays £400 for lead pieces in this section and £300 for every other piece."

relationship: Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication
Ongoing/pre-existing relationship with editor or publication

comment: "First article accepted after submitting several pitches. Long wait to run and then fast edit. They generally pay 300 pounds for 700 words, but the rate has creeped up."
"Quick turnover. Light, but thorough edit. Economist generally pays 300 pounds for 700 words, but the rate was surprisingly more. Paid some travel expenses. "
